creator: arifp1@yahoo.com
text:
When using apache on Solaris, I see the following error quite often in the 
apache log file, when trying to access the apache web server from an Internet 
Explorer (version 5.5) running on a Windows 2000 machine:

[Mon Jul 15 13:51:59 2002] [warn] (22)Invalid argument: setsockopt: 
(TCP_NODELAY)

From the client side, I click on a link and get a standard Http error - "page 
not found ..." (when apache logs the above message in its log file). I go back 
and click on the same link again, and it works. Cannot figure out why this is 
happening. Any help is greatly appreciated,

thanks,
arif.

Could you please try again with the most recent version of apache (1.3) and
reopen this report if your problem persists.

Thanks.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
Hello everybody,

At France Telecom we have had the message above in Apache 1.3.19 for Solaris 8. 
We have discovered that the source of the warning was a WSD machine (which was 
controlling from time to time the port # 80) : it opened a connection to the 
Apache port and after it received the response it closed the connexion before 
Apache and this is why the warning appeared.
creator: richard.popa@francetelecom.com
